alert.note: Alert for Allendale; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 19 at 4:54PM EDT until July 19 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF HAMPTON AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 453 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Barton to near Brunson, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Allendale Airport reported a 58 mph wind gust at 4:30 PM EDT. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of Hampton and Allendale Counties, including the following locations... Camp Branch, Valentine, Rouse, Hampton-Varnville Airport, and Dukes. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
